result.execSummary:
The defendant Dereck M Sirianni was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: SERVE 6 days with huber for work/treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification system.  39 days STAYED as deft is eligible for SSTOP program.
Any vehicle T&R in defendants name, as is defendant himself.  IID to be installed immediately.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dereck M Sirianni

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Becky.
Case called: 3:24 pm
State appears by ADA S Brubacher.  Def appears with Atty John Bliss.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed; VRCW; No restitution;

State moves to:
Ct 2 (DC)>D&RI
COURT GRANTS
PLEA: 
Ct 1 (OWI/2nd)>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: $1,579 INCLUSIVE; IMPOSE 45 days MCJ; 6 days to be served with 39 days STAYED as Defendant is eligible for SSTOP Program, w/huber for work/treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification system; deft has 45 days to report; Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant himself, both for a period of 14 months; IID to be installed immediately; Half-Priced IID ordered as defendant qualifies; 14 month DL revocation w/admin credit; Absolute sobriety; AODA; DNA Sample.
COURT notes $1,579 includes DNA surcharge; deft is entitled to 1 day jail credit;

Shall not consume alcohol. Absolute sobriety. No bars, taverns, liquor stores, or beer tents.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 within 5 business days.  No contact with victim(s): D.M. & D.Z. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
